messages.subject: Re:Critters in his hair
messages.msgSnippet: My oldest son, David, now 21, used to have little people that lived in his hands. They would fight with each other most nights when he would get ready for bed.
messages.messageBody:
My oldest son, David, now 21, used to have little people that lived
in his hands. They would fight with each other most nights when he
would get ready for bed. He had names for each of them, but I don't
remember them. He also had an alter ego named Rudy Patudi that he
blamed for everything that he got in trouble for doing. "I didn't do
it! Rudy Patudi did!" When he was around 11, he started telling
everyone,"I was never a baby! I was dropped off by aliens at the age
I am now". In fact, he still says that! :-)


-Suzanna

really a

messages.subject: Re:Critters in his hair
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/25/2002 12:31:39 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Well, yes... He has, I think, 17 squirrels, a badger, and various other creatures who live
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/25/2002 12:31:39 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Obviously the post was long before I joined the list, but ummmm, you son has
>
> critters in his hair?
> Just curious
>

Well, yes... He has, I think, 17 squirrels, a badger, and various other
creatures who live in his very curly, thick hair. Many of them seem to have
issues...there is a squirrel who thinks it's a pigeon for example. The have
been know to build condos and other structures. Many recently climbed Everest
in a special expedition. We often have conversations with these beings. It
may LOOK like we're are talking to our son's hand, but it's really a squirrel
or other critter.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
